gov.usgs.anss.edgemom

Class Subprocess

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.edgethread.EdgeThread
        • gov.usgs.anss.edgemom.Subprocess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class Subprocess
extends EdgeThread
    This class wraps up the Process class by providing simple err and output processing. It executes a command using the Runtime.getRuntime().exec() function as a subprocess which could still be running after constuction. It facilitates getting the returned stderr and stdout as strings and allows for a waitFor(). It mainly is used to hide the details of getting the err and output from the users and the details of process control. It prevents OS dependent lock ups if stdout and stderr have lots of output and need to be relieved. This Class extends thread and the run() method empties the stderr and stdout every 0.1 seconds and exits when it discovers the subprocess has exited. The waitFor() not only waits for the subprocess to exit, but insures the run() has exited, while insuring that the stdout and stdin buffers are complete before returning.

    This class does not have EdgeThread arguments. The arguments are passed to the subprocess.

      • run

        public void run()
        This is implemented as a Thread so that it will keep reading any stderr or stdout input into the StringBuffers so that they cannot block the operating system from running the subprocess. Read any input each 1/10th second and exits when the subprocess has exited.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • waitFor

        public int waitFor()
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait for this subprocess to exit. This suspends the current thread until the subprocess is done. Be careful that the subprocess does not dead lock or run continuously.
        Returns:
        Exit value of process, zero is success.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException: - This Means that wait did not complete but was interrupted.
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • exitValue

        public int exitValue()
        Returns the exit status of the subprocess. If the subprocess is still running, this should return -99 to indicate it is still running. This can be used to test for the process still running without blocking the thread's execution.
        Returns:
        The exit status of the subprocess or -99 if the subprocess is still running.

      • getOutput

        public java.lang.StringBuilder getOutput()
        Return the output of the subprocess as a string. If the subprocess is still running, it may return some portion of the stdout to this point, but will not block.
        Returns:
        String with the contents of stdout.

      • getOutput

        public java.lang.StringBuilder getOutput(boolean clear)
        Return the output of the subprocess as a string. If the subprocess is still running, it may return some portion of the stdout to this point, but will not block. If flag is true, clear the output buffer.
        Parameters:
        clear - If true, clear the output buffer after getting the string.
        Returns:
        String with the contents of stdout.

      • getErrorOutput

        public java.lang.StringBuilder getErrorOutput()
        Return error output to date of the subprocess. If the subprocess is still running, it may return some portion of the stderr to this point, but will not block.
        Returns:
        String with contents of stderr.
